JUDGES: Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by Mr M. İriz and PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , lawyers practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant ’s version of the events , on DATE , at TIME , the applicant was arrested by CARDINAL plainclothes policemen and CARDINAL uniformed police officer on a street in the GPE district of GPE , GPE , on suspicion of having participated in an illegal demonstration . He was put in a commercial taxi and taken to FAC . There , the applicant was punched , kicked and beaten with truncheons by officers , who broke his nose , which started bleeding . The officers took him to LOC . The doctors applied a bandage to his nose . He was then taken to ORG and had a nose x - ray . On DATE , at TIME , he was handed over to police officers from the anti - terrorism branch of ORG . The applicant was subjected to further beatings at the anti - terrorism branch and was asked to become a police informer .

CARDINAL . According to the ORG , on DATE , the applicant took part in an illegal demonstration and was chanting slogans in favour of the ORG ( ORG ) . When the security forces arrived at the scene of the demonstration to disperse the crowd , the applicant attempted to escape and fell on the ground . Thereafter , he was surrounded by a group of people living in the neighbourhood and beaten . The police officers rescued him and put him in a taxi and then took him to the LOC police station . He was immediately taken to ORG Nuri Burat State Hospital for medical examination and treatment before placing him in custody . According to the medical report issued by a doctor , at TIME , the applicant bore a number of injuries . The doctor noted the presence of scratches , oedema and lesions on the nose , an ecchymosis measuring CARDINAL on the side of the left eye , an ecchymosis inside his lower lip as well as haematoma measuring CARDINAL on the face .

CARDINAL . DATE the applicant was taken to ORG for further treatment . The medical report , issued at TIME , stated that the applicant bore lesions and ecchymoses on his lower lip , nose and left knee .
CARDINAL . On DATE , in his statements to the anti - terrorism police , the applicant stated that he had been beaten by the local people and had been rescued by the police officers .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken to a branch of ORG in GPE for medical examination . The medical report prepared by a forensic doctor stated that the ecchymoses , swelling and lesions observed on the applicant ’s body as well as the broken nose were not life threatening but would prevent him to carry out his regular work for DATE . This medical report was signed by the applicant and also contained his hand written statement which read :
“ The bruises , swellings and scratches on my body as well as the broken bone in my nose had been caused by the assault of a CARDINAL people at the exit of the local bazaar . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was brought before ORG , where he denied the charges against him . He was released DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed CARDINAL separate complaints with the PERSON and ORG against the police officers who had allegedly ill - treated him in custody at FAC and at the anti - terrorism branch , respectively . He also claimed that his statements dated DATE had been obtained under duress and that he had been forced to sign those statements without reading . ORG then sent the applicant to ORG for medical examination .

CARDINAL . The preliminary medical report issued by ORG on DATE indicated the presence of chest pain and an ecchymosis on the left leg , an ecchymosis of QUANTITY under his left eye , an ecchymosis of CARDINAL cm under his right eye , an ecchymosis inside his lower lip as well as an oedema . Given the applicant ’s allegation that his nose could have been broken , the doctor recommended an x - ray examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG prosecutor took statements from the applicant in relation to his allegations of ill - treatment . The applicant claimed that following his arrest he had been beaten up by the police officers and that his nose had been broken . He asked ORG to initiate criminal proceedings against the police officers .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was referred for a further medical examination by ORG . On DATE ORG issued a definitive report on his medical condition , which made reference to the findings of a report dated DATE by ORG . In the latter , it was stated that the applicant had an ecchymosis of QUANTITY under his left eye , estimated to be DATE , an ecchymosis of QUANTITY under his right eye , an ecchymosis of ORG inside his lower lip as well as an oedema , estimated to be CARDINAL or DATE , and pain in the nose . His injuries were not regarded as life threatening but were classified as sufficient to render him unfit for DATE .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the ORG public prosecutor filed an indictment with ORG , charging QUANTITY police officers from FAC with inflicting ill - treatment on the applicant , under LAW .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG commenced the trial and scheduled the first hearing for DATE .

CARDINAL . During the hearing of DATE , ORG heard statements from the accused police officers and the applicant as the complainant . All defendants denied the allegations . The applicant identified a police officer , ORG , as being one of the officers who had arrested him and had beaten him at FAC . DATE , the public prosecutor submitted to the court that the offence in question fell within the scope of PERSON no . DATE ( the PERSON on the Prosecution of Civil Servants and Public Officials ) . Accordingly , he requested that the case file be sent to the LOC Governor for leave to prosecute the police officers under that law . The court complied with this request , stopped the trial and sent the case file to ORG . GPE then appointed an investigator to conduct an investigation into the applicant ’s allegations .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator also heard Mr ORG , the taxi driver who took the applicant to the GPE police station . The latter stated that he had parked his car in the area and had been watching the applicant being beaten up by the local people . CARDINAL police officers arrived at scene and had rescued him from the assault of the crowd . They then put the applicant in his car and had asked him to drive to the police station . He submitted that the applicant ’s face had been covered with blood when he had been put in his car .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator took statements from CARDINAL police officers who were on duty that day at the aforementioned police stations . The accused police officers claimed that , contrary to the applicant ’s allegations , they had rescued him from the angry crowd and had brought him to the police station .

CARDINAL . On DATE , relying on the investigation report prepared by the investigator , the District Governor decided not to permit the prosecution of the officers . This decision stated that the police officers , who had been patrolling after an illegal demonstration in the GPE district , had seen some local people beating the applicant . The officers had put the applicant into a taxi and had taken him to the police station , and TIME they had handed him over to the anti - terrorism branch . LOC concluded that , apart from the applicant ’s allegations , there was no evidence to prosecute the accused .
CARDINAL . The applicant challenged this decision before ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the Governor ’s decision . It noted that the taxi driver that day had testified that the applicant ’s face had been covered in blood when the police officers had put him into his vehicle . Moreover , the applicant , in his statement to the anti - terrorism police , had admitted that he had been beaten by some locals who had caught him as he was running away .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG issued a decision of nonprosecution concerning the applicant ’s complaint against the police officers from the anti - terrorism branch . He noted that in his statement of CARDINAL DATE to the anti - terrorism police , the applicant had maintained that he had been rescued by the officers from local people who had been beating him . On DATE he had been examined by ORG at ORG . The applicant had written in the medical report of DATE that the injuries on his body and the fracture to his nose had been inflicted by some local people , and had added his signature .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against this decision before ORG , which on DATE upheld the decision .
CARDINAL . A full description of the domestic law and practice at the relevant time may be found in GPE and Others v. GPE ( nos . PERSON and CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , ECHR CARDINALIV ) .
